content.question:
A car is traveling on a straight road. For <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>24</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CAB@</annotation> </semantics> </math> seconds, the car's velocity v(t), in meters per second, is modeled by the piecewise-linear function defined by the graph above.

(a) Find <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mrow> <mn>24</mn> </mrow> </msubsup> <mi>v</mi> </mrow> </mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mtext> </mtext><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4202@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Using correct units, explain the meaning of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mrow> <mn>24</mn> </mrow> </msubsup> <mi>v</mi> </mrow> </mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mtext> </mtext><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4202@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

frqParts.text:
A car is traveling on a straight road. For <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>24</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CAB@</annotation> </semantics> </math> seconds, the car's velocity v(t), in meters per second, is modeled by the piecewise-linear function defined by the graph above.

(a) Find <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mrow> <mn>24</mn> </mrow> </msubsup> <mi>v</mi> </mrow> </mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mtext> </mtext><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4202@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Using correct units, explain the meaning of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mrow> <mn>24</mn> </mrow> </msubsup> <mi>v</mi> </mrow> </mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mtext> </mtext><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4202@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.
(b) For each of v'(4) and v'(20), find the value or explain why it does not exist. Indicate units of measure.
(c) Let a(t) be the car's acceleration at time t, in meters per second per second. For 0 < t < 24, write a piecewise-defined function for a(t).

(d) Find the average rate of change of v over the interval <math> <mrow> <mn>8</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>20</mn></mrow> </math>. Does the Mean Value Theorem guarantee a value of c, for 8 < c < 20, such that v'(c) is equal to this average rate of change? Why or why not?

topic.text: 2.2: Defining the Derivative of a Function and Using Derivative Notation

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
